skill.name: scientific-brainstorming
skill.description: Creative research ideation and exploration. Use for open-ended brainstorming sessions, exploring interdisciplinary connections, challenging assumptions, or identifying research gaps. Best for early-stage research planning when you do not have specific observations yet. For formulating testable hypotheses from data use hypothesis-generation.

security_audit.summary: This is a purely conversational AI skill with no code execution, network access, or file system operations. It provides structured brainstorming methodologies and guidance for scientific research ideation. No security risks detected.

content.value_statement: Struggling to find your next research direction? This skill acts as your creative research partner, helping you explore interdisciplinary connections and discover breakthrough ideas through structured brainstorming techniques.
actual_capabilities: Guides structured brainstorming sessions using proven scientific methodologies
Explores interdisciplinary connections and cross-domain analogies
Challenges assumptions using reversal and constraint modification techniques
Applies frameworks like SCAMPER, Six Thinking Hats, and biomimicry
Suggests experimental designs and identifies research gaps
limitations: Does not perform literature searches or data analysis
Cannot access external databases or research papers
Limited to ideation phase, not hypothesis testing or validation
Requires active user participation for best results

use_cases.title: Find Your Thesis Topic

use_cases.title: Break Through Research Blocks
use_cases.description: Overcome creative barriers and discover novel approaches when your research hits a dead end

use_cases.title: Bridge Knowledge Domains
use_cases.description: Generate innovative ideas by connecting concepts from different scientific disciplines

prompt_templates.title: Quick Brainstorm
prompt_templates.scenario: When you need fresh ideas fast
prompt_templates.prompt: I'm studying [your field] and interested in [broad topic]. What are some unconventional research directions I could explore?

prompt_templates.title: Challenge Assumptions
prompt_templates.prompt: Everyone in my field assumes [common assumption]. What if this assumption is wrong? What research opportunities would emerge?

prompt_templates.title: Cross-Domain Inspiration
prompt_templates.prompt: How might concepts from [different field] apply to my research on [your topic]? What analogies or methods could transfer?

prompt_templates.title: Research Gap Discovery
prompt_templates.prompt: What important questions in [research area] remain unanswered? Where are the blind spots that nobody is studying?

best_practices: Be specific about your research interests and constraints to get targeted suggestions
Engage actively by building on AI suggestions and sharing your own ideas
Use multiple brainstorming techniques in sequence for comprehensive exploration
Document promising ideas immediately for later evaluation
anti_patterns: Expecting fully-formed research proposals without your active participation
Rejecting unconventional ideas too quickly without exploration
Focusing only on feasibility at the expense of creativity
Using the skill as a substitute for literature review and data analysis

faq.question: Is this skill compatible with all Claude versions?
faq.answer: Yes, this skill works with Claude, Claude Code, and other Claude-powered tools. It uses conversational AI without external dependencies.

faq.question: How many research ideas can it generate?
faq.answer: The skill can generate unlimited ideas across any scientific discipline. Quality depends on how well you articulate your research context and constraints.

faq.question: Can it help with grant proposal development?
faq.answer: While it excels at generating novel research directions, you'll need to develop specific aims, methodologies, and budgets separately for proposals.

faq.question: Is my research information kept confidential?
faq.answer: Yes, this is a conversational skill that doesn't store or transmit data externally. All brainstorming happens within your Claude session.

faq.question: What if the ideas seem too wild or impractical?
faq.answer: Start with divergent thinking to explore possibilities, then use the skill's evaluation phase to refine ideas into feasible research directions.

faq.question: How does this compare to brainstorming with colleagues?
faq.answer: The AI offers unbiased perspectives and cross-disciplinary knowledge, while human colleagues provide domain expertise and institutional knowledge. Use both for best results.
